items.sentence: It's been reported that children as young as three and a half years old are capable of telling lies.
That knife wasn't sharp and I couldn't cut the meat with it, so I resorted to using my pocket knife.
This drawing is less than great. He needs to do something with the line here at the back of the leg.
I know that Tom can play the clarinet and the bassoon. Can he play the flute and the saxophone, too?
The salesman was trying to pressure Tom into buying something he didn't want, so Tom left the store.
Tom forgot his shopping list and only got half of what he had intended to get when he went shopping.
It'll be hard to find a good plumber who's willing to come to your house in the middle of the night.
By the time Tom got to the train station, the train he wanted to catch had already left the station.
Tom's father told him to forget about becoming an artist, because he'd never earn enough to live on.
You get tired of a beautiful woman after three days. You get used to an ugly woman after three days.
